ext_description.p: An Assembly_module_interface_terminal is a type of . An Assembly_module_interface_terminal is the terminal accessed by an external application. The Assembly_module_interface_terminal is not supported by all systems, but is supplied for structural integrity in a multi-level hierarchy.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Assembly_module_terminal is a type of
for an
that provides a replication of an interface terminal associated with an . The replication provides an interface terminal for the assembly view.
An Assembly_module_terminal may be an
or additionally may be a . An Assembly_module_terminal may be associated with an instance of
to specify a connector level interface definition for an assembly. This association is maintained in the usage view.
The Assembly_module_terminal supports multi-level design, analysis, and verification in a multi-discipline environment. Explicit description of Assembly_module_terminals allows connectivity requirements to be explicitly stated and interference requirements to be identified early in the design and development cycle. The availability of explicit connector data provides the ability to more easily distinguish terminals that are physically part of different connectors, as well as letting the connector location transform locate all terminals for that connector.
If there is a connector associated with the terminal, then the terminal is actually a terminal of that connector and not separate from that connector.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_module_terminal. There may be more than one
for an Assembly_module_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.
ext_description.note:
The specified by the terminal or mounting feature may be the same
that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:

that is referenced by the related_connector. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

a
that relates to a
that is defined by a
that is the
of the reference_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
If the related_connector exists then associated_definition shall be the assembly for the related_connector.
If the related_connector exists then for that connector shall exist.
If the reference_terminal is defined, it shall be an interface terminal.
If a related_connector is specified, the position, shape, and orientation of the Assembly_module_terminal shall be overriden by the reference_terminal position, shape, and orientation.
A related_connector shall be specified if and only if the reference_terminal is specified.

ext_description.p: An Assembly_module_usage_view is a type of . An Assembly_module_usage_view provides additional domain knowledge for the design organization.
ext_description.note: The Assembly_module_usage_view supports intellectual property protection. A design organization can control the amount of data they provide to a licensee or purchaser by including only a specifically tailored set of data in a usage view.

Shape information is provided by
or by .

In order to exchange exact connector data as part of the usage view, members of may be populated to explicitly relate a connector definition to the usage view. Note that the connector view included may just be that required to satisfy the interface definition requirements and may not be the same connector view that exists in the design department archive for internal design purposes. WR1 inherited from constrains the members of Assembly_module_usage_view for this purpose.
ext_description.example: This data can include the information currently included in an interface control drawing (ICD). Other data included in an ICD might be members of .

Figure 1 illustrates that the information in an Assembly_module_usage_view can be different from the information in a design view. The information in this illustration is sufficient to analyse airflow characteristics and interference characteristics, as well as information related to the connectors in the design.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Assembly_module_usage_view is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Assembly_module_usage_view as its . There shall be zero or more Assembly_module_terminals for an Assembly_module_usage_view.

specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_module_usage_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The function implemented shall be the function whose terminals are mapped to the terminals of this assembly module usage view.
